reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 177/98: GROUND SOURCE HEAT PUMPS
reg_info.act_under: Environmental Protection Act   Loi sur la protection de l’environnement

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “ground source heat pump” means a heating and cooling system for buildings that uses a liquid to exchange heat with the ground or ground water. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“ground source heat pump” means a heating and cooling system for buildings that uses a liquid to exchange heat with the ground or ground water. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 1.

content.content: 2. A ground source heat pump that uses a liquid other than methanol is exempted from section 9 of the Act. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. A ground source heat pump that uses a liquid other than methanol is exempted from section 9 of the Act. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 2.

content.content: 3. (1) No ground source heat pump that uses methanol shall be used unless it was put into operation before June 1, 1998. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 3 (1). (2) No ground source heat pump that uses methanol shall be constructed, altered, extended or replaced. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 3 (2).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) No ground source heat pump that uses methanol shall be used unless it was put into operation before June 1, 1998. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 3 (1).

(2) No ground source heat pump that uses methanol shall be constructed, altered, extended or replaced. O. Reg. 177/98, s. 3 (2).

content.content: 4. Omitted (revokes other Regulations). O. Reg. 177/98, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. Omitted (revokes other Regulations). O. Reg. 177/98, s. 4.
